TopicTitle: FAR working whenever it wants to?

Articles.Content:
Im a great fan of, lest say somewhat "realistic" rockets, trying to recreate conditions like real rockets experiment as much as possible but creating my desgings, anyway FAR a very important mod in my install,who always worked great in my 0.23.5 suddendly stopped working, i was back to stock aerodynamics, the weirdest part, was that the toolbar plugin showed that FAR was currently working, but i could clearly see that my rocket was unnafected by FAR's aerodynamic model.

So i staged some boosters and the rocket inmedeatly did a 360Ã‚Âº flip and tore apart core's stage main engine, i right clicked and the the stat's were back, i reverted to launch and started again, everything normal, FAR working, stage boosters, it kept working, the another stage and stoped, all of sudden, i kept flying until fairing separation to release the probe, then far kicked on again.

After i was in space with no aerodynamic forces present, i did two more launches and something similar happened, in the last one FAR didn't work all the way until i was in space! it useless up there!.

Edited May 3, 2014 by thunderstar
You might want to check your debug console (Alt+F2) and check what might cause this bug. FAR by itself works really reliable, I'd guess something else mucks its work up.
Post the output_log.txt from KSP_Data. I need the output_log.txt to have any hope of fixing the issue, if I can even do anything about it.

sure here's the link: output_log

thanks for the help

You are using an old version of FAR that has a bug with some AIES parts, in particular, engines that define a ModuleJettison (which controls the stock engine fairings) but the ModuleJettison does not point to an existing part of the model. Update FAR and the issue should go away.
oh great thanks, i should have noticed that haha, thank you very much ferram, keep updating your awesome mod!
